question.content: Do you have any Massachusetts W2 employees or Massachusetts 1099-MISC?

options.label: No
options.message: You are not required to participate in the PFML program.

helpText: A MA W2 employee is anyone to whom you are required to issue a W2 form for performing services in Massachusetts.
question.text: What is the average number of Massachusetts W2 employees in your workforce over the last calendar year?

helpText: A MA 1099-MISC contractor is an individual that resides in Massachusetts for whom you are required to report payment for services on IRS Form 1099-MISC.
question.text: What is the average number of Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors in your workforce over the last calendar year?

paragraph.text: Based on the makeup of your workforce, all your Massachusetts W2 employees and Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors are “covered individuals.”
triggerText: Massachusetts W2 employees and Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors
helpText: If your Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors are equal to or greater than the amount of Massachusetts W2 employees you employ, they are considered covered individuals and you are responsible for sending contributions on their behalf.

• W2 employees will always count as covered individuals
  • 1099-MISC contractors count toward your total number of covered individuals only if they make up more than 50 percent of your total workforce (W2 employees and 1099-MISC combined)

paragraph.content: Starting July 1, 2019, you are required to send Paid Family and Medical Leave contributions every quarter to the Department of Family and Medical Leave. The full contribution is split between an employer share and a covered individual share.
Covered individuals will be responsible for 100% of the family leave contribution and 40% of the medical leave contribution. You may deduct these amounts from the wages of your covered individuals.

paragraph.text: You are required to pay the remaining employer share of the total contribution. The employer share is at least 60% of the medical leave contribution.
triggerText: required to pay the remaining employer share
helpText: If you have 25 or more covered individuals, you are required to pay the employer share.

paragraph.text: Based on the makeup of your workforce, only your Massachusetts W2 employees are “covered individuals.”
helpText: If you have fewer Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors than Massachusetts W2 employees, the Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors are not considered covered individuals and you are not responsible for sending contributions on their behalf.

• W2 employees will always count as covered individuals
  • 1099-MISC contractors count toward your total number of covered individuals only if they make up more than 50 percent of your total workforce (W2 employees and 1099-MISC combined)

paragraph.content: Starting July 1, 2019, you are required to send Paid Family and Medical Leave contributions every quarter to the Department of Family and Medical Leave. The full contribution is split between an employer share and a covered individual share.
Covered individuals will be responsible for 100% of the family leave contribution and 40% of the medical leave contribution. You may deduct these amounts from the wages of your covered individuals.

paragraph.text: You are required to pay the remaining employer share of the total contribution. The employer share is at least 60% of the medical leave contribution.
triggerText: required to pay the remaining employer share
helpText: If you have 25 or more covered individuals, you are required to pay the employer share.

paragraph.text: Based on the makeup of your workforce, all your Massachusetts W2 employees and Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors are “covered individuals.”
triggerText: Massachusetts W2 employees and Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors
helpText: If your Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors are equal to or greater than the amount of Massachusetts W2 employees you employ, they are considered covered individuals and you are responsible for sending contributions on their behalf.

• W2 employees will always count as covered individuals
  • 1099-MISC contractors count toward your total number of covered individuals only if they make up more than 50 percent of your total workforce (W2 employees and 1099-MISC combined)

paragraph.content: Starting July 1, 2019, you are required to send Paid Family and Medical Leave contributions every quarter to the Department of Family and Medical Leave. The full contribution is split between an employer share and a covered individual share.
Covered individuals will be responsible for 100% of the family leave contribution and 40% of the medical leave contribution. You may deduct these amounts from the wages of your covered individuals.

paragraph.text: You are NOT required to pay the employer share of the medical leave contribution but you may elect to cover a portion of the covered individual share.
helpText: If you have fewer than 25 covered individuals, you do not need to pay the employer share.

paragraph.text: Based on the makeup of your workforce, only your Massachusetts W2 employees are “covered individuals.”
